Her husband Vaja is a driver and the couple has two children (13 and 17 years old), who study in the local school. Iamze has 3 milk cows. Every day she produces dairy food and sells it in nearby villages. The total average monthly income of the family is 600 Lari. 

Iamze has requested a loan for purchasing a truck. With the truck, the family will be able to supply their livestock with food. Also, the truck will be used for providing agricultural goods transportation services to neighborhood farmers.  Iamze's family will be paid for this, helping to offset the family's expenses. Her husband will be busy with the truck, increasing the family income and improving their overall living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase a truck

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a divorced woman with four children, all of whom are in school. She has been selling clothes at the market for the past two years, selling to the community. She aspires to expanding the business and opening a shop in future. Elizabeth lives in a rental house that has both electricity and piped water.  Food and rent are her greatest monthly expenses.

With the loan of 30,000 KES, she wants to purchase bundles of clothes for sale.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of clothes for sale

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is from the village of Sta. Cruz, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. She is 34 years old. Helen is married and has three school-aged children.

To make a living, Helen owns and operates a transport service. Helen has been engaged in her business for more than 5 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

Helen is requesting a loan of 4,700 PHP, which will be used to purchase a motorcycle sidecar.

In 2010, Helen joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle sidecar

location.town: Sta. Cruz, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is a mother of one child who is already enrolled in school. She has been selling charcoal for the past two years, selling at retail to the local residents and people in transit. Martha thinks of opening a charcoal depot in future.

She lives in a rental house that has both electricity and piped water. She joined Yehu to get loans. She describes rent bills and food to be her greatest monthly expenses.

The loan of 30,000 will enable her to purchase sacks of charcoal for sale.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for sale

loans.name: Felina

texts.en: Felina is a widow with seven children. She is 61 years old and lives in Balili, Kinuman, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Felina owns and operates a farm, planting and harvesting corn and coconuts to earn a living. She's been in this business for 30 years. Each month, she earns 8,000 pesos. She requested a loan of 15,000 pesos to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young plants to raise and to pay the labor costs of plowing. In 2012, Felina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, Felina wants to make improvements to her house and to better the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young plants to raise and to pay the labor costs of plowing.

loans.name: Mshimba

texts.en:
Mshimba is a single man who has been doing farming for the past six years. He sells his farm produce as retail to the general pubic. He lives in a rental house that has piped water but no electricity. He describes seasonality and rent payments as his major challenges. Mshimba dreams of hiring employees in future.

With the loan of KES 15,000, he will be able to purchase seedlings, pesticides and petrol for his generator machine used in water irrigation since he does irrigation during dry season.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings, pesticides and petrol for his generator machine used in water irrigation.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah is 31 years old and married to Peter, who contributes to the family income. Together they have two children. 

She has been running a dairy milk shop for a period of about one year with a monthly income KES 22,800.

This is her first loan from KADET Ltd., and she wants to use it to buy milk in large quantity for sale. She hopes to be a leading milk supplier and give her children quality education.

loans.use: to buy milk in large quantity for sale.

loans.name: Nairi

texts.en:
Nairi is 35 years old; she lives in a small village with her family: her husband David, parents-in-law and two daughters. The family runs an agricultural business. They have milk cows and every day they actively produce cheese, curds and other dairy foods. They have a lot of customers in nearby villages because everyone knows that their products are of good quality. The family is also busy with farming. They have a plot of land where potatoes are grown. The family sells harvested product as well as dairy food on the local open market. Total average monthly income of the family is 700 Lari.

Nairi requested a loan for financing seasonal works on the plot. With this loan, she plans to purchase fertilizer and fuel for a tractor to till the land. After tilling and fertilizing, Nairi and other family members will sow potatoes and will work hard during spring and summer seasons to get a good harvest. As a result of the properly done seasonal works, the family will get a better harvest and will be able to sell it at a good price. With increased amount of profit the family will have better living conditions. Nairi hopes for your help and kindness.

loans.use: to purchase fuel and fertilizer

loans.name: Isidra

texts.en:
Isidra is a widow with two children. Isidra is 55 years old and resides at Santa Cruz, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Isidra owns and operates farm land, planting and harvesting bananas for sale to earn a living, and she's been 5 years in this business. Each month, she earns 5,000 PHP doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 3,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers and for the cost paid for banana planting.

In 2008, Isidra joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, Isidra wants to make improvements to her business and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and for the cost paid for banana planting

loans.name: Shareefan's Group

texts.en:
Shareefan is the mother of 3 sons. Her second son operates a livestock business at home while the others remain at home. She supports her husband in his business of selling tea. He operates his tea stall adjacent to his home and serves tea in cups to his clients.

Shareefan has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for further expansion of her husband’s business. With the loan investment, he will buy utensils, tea and milk in larger quantities that will allow him to serve his clients better and increase his income. He will also hire a worker for delivering tea to different shops and offices.

He is very experienced in his business and has been operating it for the past many years. Shareefan is hopeful that the loan will help him make more profits from his business.

loans.use: to buy tea, milk and utensils for tea selling business (cafe)

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 40 years old, married and supports a family of five. She has been running a general store for the last 11 years, earning a monthly income of KES 4,000. With her second loan of KES 70,000 from KADET LTD, she plans to purchase more household items for resale to her growing number of customers.

The anticipated profits will be used to restock the shop. Her future plan is to educate her children and improve their living standards

loans.use: To purchase household items for resale

loans.name: Farzana's Group

texts.en:
Farzana is 37 years of age. She is a housewife who remains at home and does her household responsibilities. Her husband has a gas cylinder sales business. He sells LPG (Liquid petroleum gas) which is used by people for cooking. 

Farzana has given birth to three sons and a daughter. Two of them are studying while her remaining children are not yet of school-going age. Farzana has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for further expansion of her husband’s gas cylinder sales business. With the loan investment, he will buy LPG gas cylinders that will allow him to fill client orders on time and increase his profits. He has been operating his business for many years and Farzana is confident that his business will have more success after investing the loan in it.

loans.use: To buy LPG cylinders for resale

loans.name: Mwanaisha

texts.en:
Mwanaisha is a woman who has been operating a kiosk for the last one year and she aspires to expand her kiosk to a shop. During the year, she has never experienced any major challenge in her business.  Mwanaisha resides in her own house that has both electricity and piped water. She narrates that her choice to join Yehu was to get access to loans to boost her business in order to reach her goal. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.
The loan of Ksh. 30,000 will help her add stock of maize and wheat flour, rice, and sugar.

loans.use: to add stock of maize and wheat flour, rice, and sugar.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to renovate his rental houses.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: Jocelyn is married and has three children. She is 28 years old and resides in Canicapan, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Jocelyn owns and operates a farm, planting and harvesting bananas. She's been doing this for seven years. Each month, she earns 3,825 pesos. She has requested a loan of 6,000 pesos to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young plants to raise. In 2011, Jocelyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, Jocelyn wants to make improvements to her house and to improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young plants to raise.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose has been operating an omena (small dried fish) selling business for the past 10 years. She sells her omena at the market, and she aims at opening a shop in future. 

Rose lives in a rental house that has piped water but no electricity. She has two school going children. She does not feel confronted by any major challenge.

She joined Yehu to secure loans. With the loan of KES 30,000, she will be able to purchase more omena for sale.

loans.use: to purchase more omena (dried fish) for sale.

loans.name: Elina

texts.en:
Elina is a widowed woman with two children, both of whom are in school. 

She lives in her own house that has both electricity and piped water. 

Elina has been selling milk to the local residents for the last 10 years, and she dreams of hiring employees in future. She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business. 

She depends on her business with no other sources of income. The loan of KES 30,000 will help her purchase gallons of milk for sale.

loans.use: to purchase gallons of milk for sale.

loans.name: Jeremiah

texts.en:
Jeremiah is 35 years old, married and supports a family of three. He has sold new clothes for the last 12 years, earning a monthly income of KES. 12,000. 

He has applied for his first loan of KES 30,000. He plans to restock his stall with new clothes for sale. The anticipated profits will help buy additional stock and help him to expand his business. 

His future plan is to achieve financial sustainability

loans.use: To purchase new clothes.

loans.name: Jannat's Group

texts.en:
Jannat is 55 years of age. She is still very active and operates a livestock business from her home. She sells cow's milk to her community customers for reasonable rates and earns good income for her family.

Her husband has a business of hosiery. He gets orders from different factories and shops in the market and completes the orders to earn income.

Jannat has given birth to three sons and three daughters. Two of them study while others stay at home. She has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for further expansion of her family dairy business. With the loan investment, she will buy a dairy cow to get a larger quantity of milk and increase her family income.

The livestock business is her family business and she is very confident that it will improve further after investing the loan.

loans.use: To buy a cow for dairy business

loans.name: Ebeteti

texts.en:
Ebeteti is 35 years old, married to Mary, and blessed with four children, age 12, 7, 4 and 4 months old. 

He sells maize, a business he started six years ago, and he earns a monthly income of KES 12,000.

He wants to purchase three bags of maize for sale and has requested a first loan of KES 11,000.

The profit he earns from his business will help him provide basic needs for his family. His dream is to one day own a taxi.

loans.use: To purchase three bags of maize for sale.

loans.name: Marthar

texts.en:
Marthar is a married woman with four children, all of whom are in school. She sells charcoal to the public, a business she has been operating for the past three years. Marthar aims at opening a charcoal depot in future to increase her sales. She has rented a house that has electricity but no running water. The high transport cost of charcoal to her place of operation is a major challenge. Her greatest monthly expenses are food, school fees, and rent.
With the loan of Ksh 20,000, she plans to purchase sacks of charcoal to increase her stock.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal to increase her stock.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 38 years old and married to Faith, who sells second-hand clothes, which contributes to the family income. John has been running his motorcycle transport business for about three years, with a monthly income of KES. 23,300. 

This is his first loan with KADET LTD, and he wants to use it to buy second-hand clothes for his wife's shop and to repair his motorcycle. He hopes to own a fleet of public service vehicles.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothes for his wife's shop and to repair his motorcycle.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is 30 years old, married to Sarah, and blessed with three children aged eight, six and two years old. He provides transport services with his motorbike, a business he ventured into three years ago and earns a monthly income of KES 6,000. 

He wants to purchase a bicycle to boost his transport business and has requested a first loan of KES. 20,000. The profit he makes will help him pay school fees for his children. His dream is to one day own a fleet of vehicles.

loans.use: To buy  a  bicycle

loans.name: Flora's Group

texts.en:
Flora has requested a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for her livestock and dairy business. With the loan investment, she will buy another buffalo that will help her get a larger quantity of milk to sell to her customers.  She is very hard-working, getting up early in the morning every day to milk her buffaloes.  

Flora has given birth to five children who remain at home and don’t do anything. She is hopeful that the loan will bring positive changes to her family business and help her family to live a better life.

loans.use: To buy a buffalo for livestock and dairy business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more products to sell like canned goods, shampoos, milk, coffee, and soap.

loans.name: Ewoton

texts.en:
Ewoton is 36 years old, married to Catherine, and blessed with four children, age 12, 10, 8 and 6 years old. 

He provides transport services through his motorbike, a business he ventured into three years ago, and he earns a monthly income of KES 30,000. 

He wants to start dairy farming alongside his transportation business, and he has requested a first loan of KES 20,000 to buy a dairy cow.

The profit he earns will help him pay school fees for his children. His believes that one day he'll own a car.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow for his new line of business.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 30 years old, married to Jane and blessed with four children aged eight, six, four and two years respectively. He sells clothes, a business he started six years ago, and he earns a monthly income of KES 15,000. 

Peter wants to purchase two bales of jackets for sale and has requested a first loan of KES 10,000. The profit he makes from his business will help him pay school fees for his children. 

His dream is to see his business grow as well as to educate his children.

loans.use: To purchase two bales of jackets for sale.

loans.name: Wilber Armando

texts.es:
Wilber, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para invertirlo en el negocio comprándose materia prima para la  elaboración de balcones, puertas y ventanas este material es lamina y hierro, que al tenerlo en el taller podrá aumentar su capacidad de respuesta para los clientes.
Con el préstamo anterior logro realizar la compra de materiales para realizar las estructuras metálicas, tambien compro mercaderia para la tienda, su condición familiar a mejorado muchísimo pues a dejado de alquilar vivienda porque cuenta con su propia casa.
texts.en:
Wilber is requesting a new loan to invest in his business. He will buy raw materials for making balconies, doors, and windows. These materials include metal sheets and iron. By having these materials, he will increase his capacity to respond to his customers.

With his previous loan, Wilbur will purchase materials for making metal structures. He will also buy merchandise for his store. His family's condition has improved greatly now that he has stopped renting and has a house of his own.

loans.use: to buy metal sheets and iron.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
El Sr. José, vive en la ciudad de Villa Elisa, tiene37 años de edad, es soltero pero tiene un hijo de 1 año y 2 meses. Según cuenta desde muy joven trabajaba en el Mercado Central de Abasto vendiendo Café como desayuno de los que trabajaban en el lugar, estuvo ahí como 20 años.
Más adelante frente a su casa que está en una avenida muy importante adquirió un carrito de panchos y por las noches empezó en su casa a vender, después como veía que tenia ventas decidió hacer por las mañanas comestibles como empanadas, milanesas, sándwiches, hamburguesas, y venta de gaseosas y cervezas.
Hoy día tiene pensado adquirir una máquina de hace pollo al spiedo, y habilitar para los fines de semana, es por ello que solicita el crédito para poder seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
José lives in the city of Villa Elisa. He is 37 years of age, single, and has a son aged one year and two months. From a young age he worked in the wholesale food market, where he sold coffee for breakfast to the people who worked there. He did this for about 20 years.


Later he bought a hotdog stand opposite his house, which is located on an important avenue. At night he sold hotdogs from his house. As he saw his sales grow, he decided to sell food in the mornings as well, such as empanadas (meat-filled pastries), fried breaded meats, sandwiches, hamburgers and sodas and beers.


Today José wants to buy a machine to make rotisserie chicken. He plans to use it at the weekends, and has requested this loan so that his business can continue to grow.

loans.use: To buy a machine to make rotisserie chicken.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
La Sra. Sonia tienne 37 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Villa Elisa, vive en pareja hace 13 años con el sr Antonio, quien trabaja en una aguatería privada y ayuda en la casa también, juntos tienen 2 hijos un varón de 17 años y una nena de 11 años ambos están en el colegio.
Sonia cuenta que desde muy jóven se dedica al comercio, porque vendía junto a su madre mercerías y ropas en general casa por casa, más adelante ella integró un grupo de comité de mujeres y empezó a elaborar productos de limpiezas como detergente, desodorante, enjuague para ropas, además de eso terminó su curso de manicura y pedicuro,  en el cual actualmente se trabaja y realiza visitas a domicilio porque ya tiene clientela formada ya que siempre hace muy buenos trabajos y por ello es muy conocida.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de esmaltes, equipos de pedicuros, removedor de esmaltes y demás, para poder seguir trabajando y ganando sus sustento diario.
texts.en:
Sonia is 37 years of age. She lives in the city of Villa Elisa with her partner of 13 years Antonio, who works for a private drinking water supplier and also helps out at home. Together they have two children (a boy aged 17 and a girl aged 11), both of whom are at school.


From a young age Sonia worked selling items. Along with her mother she sold goods and general clothing items door-to-door. Later she joined a women’s committee and started to make cleaning products such as detergent, deodorant and fabric softener. She also finished her manicure and pedicure course, and now works in this field. She makes house visits, and has built up a customer base thanks to her consistently good work and because she is well-known.


Sonia has requested a loan to buy nail polish, pedicure kits and nail polish remover, among other items. This will allow her to continue working and will give her a daily income.

loans.use: To buy nail polish, pedicure kits and nail polish remover, among other items.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La Sra. Juana es casada, tiene 3 hijos ya mayores. Ella se dedica al servicio de taxi,  tiene 2 vehículos,  comenta que con mucho esfuerzo logro comprar sus vehículos, ya hace 10 años que se dedica a este trabajo.
Es gracias a esto que ella ha podido mantener a su familia y darles lo que necesitan para el día a día.  Juana nos dice que quiere seguir trabajando y creciendo como microempresaria.
Ella  solicita el crédito para la compra de una parada de taxis, ya que tiene un vehículo que no está en circulación y quiere hacerlo trabajar también. Sueña con comprar mas vehículos y seguir dando trabajo a la gente de su cuidad.
texts.en:
Juana is married and has three adult children. She has a taxi service, and owns two vehicles. She bought her taxis after a lot of effort, and has been working in this field for ten years. This is how she has supported her family and given them all they need each day. She wants to keep working and growing as a small business owner.


Juana has requested this loan to buy a taxi stand, as she has one vehicle which isn’t on the road and she wants to make use of it as well. Her dream is to buy more vehicles and continue creating work for the people of her city.

loans.use: To buy a taxi stand.

loans.name: Modupè Tiamy's Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est composé de deux personnes. La représentante du groupe du nom de Modupè Tiamy est âgée de 29 ans. Modukpè Tiamy est mariée et a cinq enfants dont trois sont scolarisés avec trois personnes à charge. Elle est a un niveau d'instruction secondaire. Pour supporter les charges quotidiennes, elle mène comme activité la vente des boîtes de conserve, des macaronies, des savons, sucres et autres depuis 08 ans. Elle s'approvisionne dans les marchés de Cotonou. Dans le but de répondre aux exigences de ses clients, Mondupè Tiamy a sollicité et a obtenu, ensemble avec sa coéquipière un micro crédit auprès de Finadev. Mondupè Tiamy se retrouve à gauche de la photo.
texts.en:
This group consists of two people. The group leader is Modupè Tiamy, age 29. Modukpè Tiamy is married with five children, three of whom attend school. She supports three dependents. She attended school up to the secondary level. 

To help with the daily household expenses, she started selling canned goods, macaroni, soap, sugar and other goods eight years ago. She buys her stock at the markets of Cotonou. 

To meet customer demand, Mondupè Tiamy ontained a loan from Finadev together with the other group member. 

Mondupè Tiamy is on the left in the photo.

loans.use: to buy one box of macaroni, one box of soap, one carton of canned goods, and two boxes of sugar.

loans.name: Merla

texts.en:
This is Merla, 49, a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Bernard, a tricycle driver, and she is the mother to four children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.          
                   
Merla operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 19,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add in her inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Merla hopes to grow her business in the coming years and dreams of giving her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 40 years old, married to Hellen, and blessed with seven children, age 16, 13, 9, 8, 6, 3 and a 3-month-old baby. He provides transport services through his bicycle, a business he ventured into seven years ago, and he earns a monthly income of KES 9,000. 

He wants to purchase another bicycle for additional income and has requested a first loan of KES 10,000.

The profit he makes from his business will aid him in paying school fees for his children. His dream is to one day own a motorbike.

loans.use: To purchase another bicycle for the transport business.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph  is 26 years old and lives in the Philippines.  He is single and has no children yet.

Joseph is a carpenter who helps in creating houses and buildings in town.  He  earns approximately PHP 3000 each month doing this type of work. He has requested a loan of PHP 5000 to pay for his obligations.  Part will be used to purchase carpentry materials such as a hammer and nails.

Joseph joined HSPFI in 2012. In the future,  Joseph  hopes to improve his skills and to build his own business for his future family.

loans.use: to buy additional tools for carpentry such as a hammer and nails and to pay for his obligations

loans.name: Mamadou

texts.fr: Monsieur Mamadou habite au Sénégal. C’est un marchand ambulant qui  s’active dans le secteur du commerce et pratique la vente de produits divers. Il voyage régulièrement vers un des pays limitrophes du Sénégal pour se procurer des effets de toilette et des tissus qu’il place à ses clients. Ce sont les revenus qu’il  gagne à travers son activité qui lui donne la possibilité de  participer à la gestion des besoins familiaux (payer les frais scolaires et améliorer les conditions alimentaires de la famille. Il capitalise une expérience de 12 ans dans son activité. Il est membre du guichet de l’U-IMCEC de la localité ou il a déjà remboursé 2 crédits antérieurs. Il sollicite un prêt de 300 000 frs prévu pour l’achat d’habits, de parfums et de cosmétiques pour satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle. Son objectif est de  mieux développer son activité de commerce  et augmenter ses revenus.
texts.en:
Mr. Mamadou lives in Senegal. He is a traveling salesman offering a variety of goods. He travels regularly to a country bordering Senegal to acquire grooming items and fabrics for his customers. The income earned through this activity allows him to help with the household expenses (paying for tuition and improving the family’s lifestyle). He has 12 years of experience in this activity.

He is a member of the local U-IMCEC branch where he has already repaid two previous loans. 

He is seeking a loan of 300,000F to buy clothing, perfume and cosmetic products needed to meet customer demand. His goal is to improve his activity and bolster his income.

loans.use: to buy clothing and perfume for resale.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married woman with one school-attending child who is four years old. She sells milk at retail to the local residents, a business she has been doing for the past five years. She joined Yehu to get access to loans and expand the business.

Mary owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. She dreams of opening a clothes shop in future and hiring employees. 

She describes seasonality to be her major challenge. She plans to use the loan of 20,000 KES to purchase gallons of milk for sale.

loans.use: to purchase gallons of milk for sale

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a 32-year-old businessman, who is married to Shifrira, a mixed crop farmer.  The couple is blessed with one child. John has been operating motorcycle transport as a primary business and mixed crop farming as a secondary business for the past 10 years, earning a monthly income of KES. 20,000, which he uses to support his family. 

He is applying for his second loan from KADET LTD, after successfully repaying the previous loan.  John will use the loan to buy a piece of land for mixed crop farming. 

With the anticipated profit from the two businesses, he will educate his child. His hopes and dreams are to start large-scale farming and to export the farm products.

loans.use: to buy a piece of land for mixed crop farming.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is 44 years old, married and blessed with six children between the ages of  6 and 23 years. She sells fruit and sweet potatoes, a business she started 17 years ago, and earns a monthly income of KES. 70,000. 

She has requested her first loan, of KES. 30,000, to purchase more fruit and sweet potatoes to sell. The profit she earns will be plowed back into her business. 

Her dream is to give her children the best education as well as to be the best in everything she sets her hands on.

loans.use: To purchase more fruit and sweet potatoes to sell.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a 25-year-old businessman, who is married to Mary, a mixed crop farmer.  The couple is blessed with one child. Peter has been operating motorcycle transport as a primary business and has been farming mixed crops as a secondary business for the past 10 years.  He earns a monthly income of KES 10,000, which he uses to support his family. 

He is applying for his second loan from KADET LTD, after successfully repaying the previous loan.  Peter will use the loan to buy a piece of land for mixed crop farming. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, he will educate his child. His hopes and dreams are to start large-scale farming and export the farm products.

loans.use: to buy a piece of land for mixed crop farming.

loans.name: Elmer Alirio

texts.es:
Elmer, esta solicitando un préstamo para el fortalecimiento del negocio, comprándose mercadería para llaveros y material para hacer llaves también comprara CDs. y Dvd musicales y de películas, esperando tener la aceptación de sus clientes y seguir mejorando sus ventas.
El préstamo anterior le ayudo para mejorar el equipo de alarmas, con el cual hace las instalaciones a los vehiculos,  esto le a permitido mantenerse en el negocio y brindar un buen servicio a sus clientes, ya que por los prestamos ha logrado siempre mantener lo necesario para atender la demanda.
texts.en:
Elmer is requesting a loan to strengthen his business. He will buy supplies and materials for making key rings and keys. Elmer will also buy CDs, musical DVDs, and movies. He is hoping to have acceptance from his customers and to improve his sales.

His previous loan helped to improve his inventory of car alarms, which he installs into vehicles. This allowed him to stay in business and provide good service to his customers. With the loans, he has always maintained what he needs to satisfy the demand.

loans.use: to buy supplies and materials for making key rings and keys, CDs, musical DVDs, and movies.

loans.name: Gulsayra

texts.ru:
Гулсайре 54 года, замужем. В качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи, Гулсайра на протяжении 20 лет занимается полеводством и животноводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы в 1,200 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний  день в хозяйстве Гулсайры имеется 2 коровы, 1 теленок, продажа молока и молочных продуктов приносит около 7,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Гулсайра обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку бычков.  Доходы от кредита Гулсайра планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение хозяйства.
texts.en:
Gulsayra is 54 years old and married. As the main source of income for her family, Gulsayra has been raising livestock and growing crops for the past 20 years, having started her business with a sum of 1,200 som (KGS). Presently, her herd includes 2 cows and 1 calf, while sales of milk and dairy products bring roughly 7,000 som (KGS) per month.

In order to continue developing her business, Gulsayra has turned to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to buy more calves. She plans to reinvest her profits from this loan into further expansion of her business.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Mukhabat

texts.ru:
Мухабат - участник группы "Кенсе Суу", ей 43 года, замужем. В качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи, Мухабат с 1990 года занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы в 5,000 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний  день в хозяйстве Мухабат имеется 2 коровы, 3 овцы. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Мухабат обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 20,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку скота.  Доходы от кредита Мухабат планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение хозяйства.
texts.en:
Mukhabat is a member of the Kense Suu group. She is 43 years old and married. As the main source of income for her family, Mukhabat raises livestock, having started her business in 1990 with a sum of 5,000 som (KGS). Presently, her herd includes 2 cows and 3 sheep.

In order to continue developing her business, Mukhabat has turned to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 20,000 som (KGS) to purchase additional livestock. She plans to invest her profits from this loan into further expansion of her business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: José Faustino

texts.es:
José es un hombre divorciado de 72 años, que hace 15 años migró a "Santo Domingo" es la cuarta ciudad con más población del Ecuador después de Guayaquil, Quito y Cuenca. Su población va creciendo rápidamente ya que cuenta con un rico comercio y el mayor mercado ganadero del país. La provincia tiene de superficie 3.857 km² - 352.300 ha a una altitud de 625 msnm. Su temperatura habitual es de unos 25.5°C  y a veces llega a los 38 °C. Toda la provincia de "Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas"  figura como parte del territorio montañoso de la costa, de la cordillera occidental, históricamente conocida como Provincia de Yumbos y Capital de los Colibríes. Está ubicado en el trópico húmedo de América Latina. Es una provincia considerada nueva ya que fue creada en el 2007.

José ha cursado únicamente la educación primaria, pero a pesar de ello ha sabido ganarse el pan de cada día. Él vende sandalias de manera ambulante y trabaja aproximadamente 10 horas al día ofreciendo su producto. La vida no ha sido fácil para él, la falta de capital no le ha permitido crecer. Sin embargo sigue siendo optimista y gracias a un crédito podrá comprar más mercadería; comprará sandalias, no solamente en colores diferentes sino que también podrá surtirse con tallas siendo esto lo más importante al momento de la venta.

Este emprendedor sueña con tener un almacén propio, ya que le gusta la actividad que realiza actualmente y quisiera seguir con lo mismo.
texts.en:
José, 72, is a divorced man who 15 years ago migrated to Santo Domingo, the fourth most populated city in Ecuador after Guayaquil, Quito, and Cuenca.  Its population is growing rapidly because it is rich in trade and has the largest livestock market in the country.  The province measures 3,857 square kilometers (352,300) at an altitude of 625 meters above sea level.  The normal temperature is about 25.5°C and sometimes reaches 38°C.  The entire province of Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas is part of the mountainous coastal region of the western mountain range, known historically as Yumbos Province and the Hummingbird Capital.  It is located in the humid tropics of Latin America.  It is known as a new province because it was created in 2007.

José has only a primary education, but in spite of this he has learned how to earn a living.  He sells sandals as a street vendor and works approximately 10 hours a day offering his product.  Life has not been easy for him.  The lack of capital has not allowed him to grow.

Nevertheless he continues being optimistic and, thanks to a loan, will be able to buy more merchandise.  He will buy sandals, not only in different colors but also in different sizes, this being the most important thing at the time of purchase.

This entrepreneur dreams about having his own department store because he likes the work he does currently and would like to continue with it.

loans.use: to buy sandals to sell.

loans.name: Varduhi

texts.ru:
Вардуи занимается разведением крупного рогатого скота  и пчел в деревне Егвард на протяжении 22 лет. Полученную сельскохозяйственную продукцию: молоко, говядину и мед Вардуи и ее муж реализуют в городах Капане и Каджаране. Произведенная ими сельскохозяйственная продукция раскупается очень быстро, так как Вардуи и ее муж всегда внимательно следят за качеством своей продукции и предлагают своим покупателям только высококачественные молоко, мед и мясо. Вардуи рассказала, что пчеловодство и скотоводство требуют больших денежных и физических затрат, но ей нравиться заниматься бизнесом и обеспечивать таким образом свою семью. 
Вардуи 48 лет. После окончания школы она поступила в профтехучилище на отделение торговли. У Вардуи и  ее мужа четверо детей: 2 сына и 2 дочери. Трое детей проживают отдельно от родителей, а старший сын живет вместе с родителями и помогает им на ферме. Муж Вардуи, параллельно с работой на ферме, работает на телевизионной станции. 
Вардуи обратилась за кредитом на сумму $ 3.000 для приобретения 6 бычков для своей фермы. Бычки позволят Вардуи и ее семье значительно увеличить прибыль от скотоводства в будущем.
texts.en:
Varduhi is engaged in cattle breeding and beekeeping in the Yegvard village for 22 years. The resulting agricultural products, milk, beef and honey, Varduhi and her husband sells in the cities Kapan and Kajaran. The agricultural products they produce is sold out very fast, as Varduhi and her husband always monitor the quality of their products carefully, offering their customers only high quality milk, honey and meat. 

Varduhi told us that beekeeping and cattle breeding require large financial and physical investments, but she likes working in this business and this way provides for her family. Varduhi is 48 years old. After having finished school she enrolled at a vocational school in the Department of Commerce. Varduhi and her husband have four children: Two sons and two daughters. Three of the children live separate from the parents, and the oldest son lives together with them and helps them at the farm. Varduhi's husband works at the television station in parallel with working at the farm.

Varduhi applied for a loan in the amount of 3000 USD for the purchase of six bull-calves for her farm. The bulls allows Varduhi and her family significantly increase the profit from the cattle breeding in the future.

loans.use: to purchase 6 bull-calves for her farm

loans.name: Domingas

texts.en: Domingas is requesting $1000 loan to continue her business, which she relies on to survive and to support her children's education. She is 35 years old, and she is selling local products such as coffee, corn and green bean at her kiosk. She doesn’t have any other income-generating activities.

loans.use: To buy coffee, corn, and green beans to sell

loans.name: Ines

texts.en: Ines is 24 years old and single, and she lives a little bit far from her home town. She has a kiosk and has been in business for more than a year. She is making good income. She first started this business with her own capital; now, she is applying for $1000 loan to continue her business. In addition, she is also raising 3 pigs, 10 chickens and 5 goats.

loans.use: To buy rice to sell

loans.name: Heri

texts.en: Heri is married, 35 years old and she is opening a kiosk where she sells cakes. She works seven days a week from her home, where the kiosk is located. She is also raising 2 cows and 5 chickens, which contribute extra income when she sells them.

loans.use: To buy cakes to sell

loans.name: Claudina

texts.en: Claudina lives with her 5 children, four sons and a daughter, and her husband. She has a hard time managing everything in the family. A $600 loan is going to help her do better in her business selling petrol.  With her income, she will support her family and continue to do her business.

loans.use: To buy petrol and sell

loans.name: Albertina

texts.en:
Albertina is running her business to support her family and her four children, and she requests this loan to buy more products to put in her kiosk. She is living in a small town in Liquiça District. At home, she also raises some animals, such as cows, pigs and chickens. Her business is doing well, and she makes a profit of $188 per month. Alberta hopes to use this loan to continue to grow her business.
.

loans.use: To buy kerosene and coffee

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en: Jacinta has three children, two daughters and one son. She is 33 years old and married. She has been running her business in the market for 5 years. To continue with this business, she is requesting $1000 loan to buy fruits to sell, and for some materials she needs to repair her car to handle distribution.

loans.use: To buy fruits to sell

loans.name: Mauloba Group

texts.en: Eliana is one of the members of the Mauloba group, named after a location in East Timor. She is living in a house with a roof made from palm leaves. She sells the petrol just in front of her house, and in addition, she has some land for farming. She is 22 years old and married.

loans.use: To buy petrol to sell

loans.name: Las Juanix Group

texts.es:
Las nuevas integrantes de este grupo son la  señora Alma Rosa y Yanet quienes se dedican a diferentes actividades económicas. Yanet se dedica a la venta de comida y Alma Rosa vende refrescos y cosméticos.

La señora Alma Rosa mejor conocida como Doña Alma, de veintisiete años de edad, se caracteriza por ser amable y trabajadora. Ella se dedica a la venta de refrescos y cosméticos, los refrescos los vende en su domicilio y los cosméticos los va a ofrecer a las colonias vecinas de su comunidad. Cuenta que inició su negocio gracias a la ayuda de su suegra, ya que ella siempre le decía que vendiera refrescos porque ocasiones no tenían dinero y cuando le surgía alguna emergencia Doña Alma se angustiaba mucho  y fue en esa ocasión cuando decidió iniciar con la venta de refrescos. Sus hijos Ana Priscila, Jesús y Aidé quines le ayudan en el negocio nos dicen que están felices ya que han podido mejorar su calidad de vida, y están muy contentos de que Vision Fund los ayude y puedan engrandecer su negocio. Ella pidió su crédito para la compra de más refrescos para la venta por mayoreo y menudeo. Le da las gracias a fundacion por ayudar a todas las mujeres con ilusiones.
texts.en:
The new members of this group are Sra. Alma Rosa and Yanet, who engage in different business activities. Yanet sells food and Alma Rosa sells soft drinks and cosmetics.

Sra. Alma Rosa, who is better known as Doña Alma, is 27 years old and described as a friendly and hardworking woman. She sells soft drinks and cosmetics. The soft drinks are sold from her home and the cosmetics are offered in the neighboring subdivisions in her community. Alma says that she started her business with the help of her mother-in-law, who always told her that she should sell soft drinks. However, she only did it occasionally because she did not have money as a result of dealing with emergencies. This caused her great anguish when she decided to start selling soft drinks. Her children (Ana Priscila, Jesús, and Aidé) help with the business. Alma says that they are happy because she has improved their quality of life. She is very pleased that Vision Fund has helped her to expand her business. Alma is requesting a loan to buy more soft drinks that she can sell wholesale and at retail. She thanks Fundación Realidad for helping all women who have dreams.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks.

loans.name: Jefferson Alonso

texts.es:
Jefferson es un joven de 20 años que vive en "Santo Domingo" que es una de las ciudades más jóvenes del país, actualmente se ha constituido en el punto de enlace entre las región Sierra y Costa del Ecuador. Es un sitio privilegiado, no sólo por la riqueza étnica, sino también por los paisajes inusitados que se pueden encontrar desde el ingreso mismo a esta bella ciudad. Santo Domingo de los Colorados pertenece actualmente a la provincia de Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas, recientemente conformada.  La fiesta principal de Santo Domingo, se celebra con un movimiento intenso de visitantes, intercambio comercial y cultural. Una gran feria tiene lugar en las instalaciones de la Asociación de Ganaderos, allí se muestran y compiten los mejores ejemplares de las distintas razas y cruces que son criados en las haciendas de la región. 

Jefferson tiene un almacén de artículos para fiestas desde hace 2 años. Comenzó este emprendimiento a penas se convirtió en mayor de edad, y actualmente su madre le ayuda atendiendo el local. Con esto el contribuye en la economía de su hogar.

Empezar este negocio no ha sido fácil ya que Jefferson tiene un corto historial crediticio sin embargo él ha decidido hacer una fuerte inversión en mercadería con lo que al fin podrá acabar de llenar su local al cual le hacen falta ciertos artículos como disfraces y cosas más particulares.

Espera que con este crédito pueda cumplir su primera meta a corto plazo que es incrementar su clientela y de esta manera hacer sustentable y sostenible a su negocio.
texts.en:
Jefferson is 20 years old and he lives in Santo Domingo, one of the youngest cities in the country. It has recently become an important point between the mountain region and the coastal region of Ecuador. It's a special place, not just because of it's rich ethnic diversity but also for the unusual landscapes that can be seen as soon as you enter the city. Santo Domingo de los Colorados is part of the recently-formed province of Santo Domingo Tsáchilas. The main holiday in Santo Domingo is celebrated with a huge influx of visitors and commercial and cultural exchanges. A large fair takes place on the grounds of the Cattlemen's Association. At the fair, examples of the different breeds and mixed breeds of cows from ranches all over the region are shown in competition. 

Jefferson has had a party supply store for 2 years. He started his business as soon as he turned 18 and his mother currently helps him run it. With his earnings he is able to contribute to the household income. 

Starting the business was not easy because Jefferson has a very short credit history. Nonetheless, he has decided to make a big investment in merchandise in order to finally finish stocking his store, which lacks certain items like costumes and other things. 

He hopes that with this loan he will be able to achieve his first short-term goal, which is to expand his clientele and make his business sustainable.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for his party store.

loans.name: Juan Raul

texts.es:
El socio se sigue dedicando al negocio de elaboracion y venta de artesania,el socio vende chompas,polos,chalinas entre otras artesanias,el socio tiene una tienda donde atiende desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio el socio quiere salira adelante,el sueño del socio es ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de artesania.El socio solicita el credito para comprar polos,chompas y chalinas.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Juan Raul continues working in the production and sales of arts and crafts. He sells shirts, sweaters and scarves, among other things, in his store which is open from 8am until 7pm. Juan Raul wants to get ahead and his dream is to expand and improve his business. He is requesting a loan in order to buy more shirts, sweaters and scarves. He looks forward to receiving the loan and promises to re-pay it on time.

loans.use: to buy shirts, sweaters and scarves.

loans.name: Moyopata-San Sebastian Group

texts.es:
La socia perteneces al banco comunal MOYOPATA-SAN SEBASTIAN; este banco está situado en la provincia  de Cusco departamento de Cusco.

La socia Marisa; la socia tiene 31 años, conviviente y tiene a hijo; la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes ella vende diferentes tipos de productos como arroz,azucar,leche,golosinas,gaseosas entre otros, la socia lleva buen tiempo en este negocio el cual mediante este la socia saca adelante a su familia, la socia es una persona alegre y responsable, ella trabaja todos los días en su negocio, la socia desea poder continuar trabajando para seguir apoyando a su familia.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de mercadería  para su negocio como golosinas.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de compra y venta de alcancías y percheros, venta de libros, venta de emoliente, tienda de abarrotes, ventad e chicha, crianza de animales.

Las socias que salen adjuntas en la foto pidieron permiso para llegar tarde por motivos de trabajo.

La socia agradece este medio por el cual le facilita el crédito y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos.
texts.en:
Marisa belongs to the communal bank MOYOPATA-SAN SEBASTIAN, which is located in the Cusco province. She is 31 years old, lives with her partner and has 1 child. Marisa has a small grocery store where she sells different products like rice, milk, candies, sodas and other things. She has had the business for a while and it has helped her family to get ahead. Marisa is a positive persona and quite responsible. She works every day in her store and she hopes to continue to do so in order to continue helping her family. 

Marisa is requesting a loan to buy merchandise, like candy, for her store. 

The other members of the community bank work selling piggy banks, hangers, books, groceries, and Peruvian drinks like chicha and emoliente. Some work in animal husbandry. 

Marisa is grateful for being able to access credit in this way and is committed to repaying the loan.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizers and pay the cost of labor.

loans.name: Navil

texts.es:
Navil tiene 31 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 2 hjos.  Vive junto a su familia en una comunidad grande en la zona urbana de la ciudad de Zaña, perteneciente a la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital del Departamento de Lambayeque.
Navil se dedica desde hace más de 10 años a la crianza de ganado vacuno y animales menores, los alimenta bien, y cuando ya han alcanzado el peso y tamaño ideal los vende.  Esta actividad la realiza en su propio domicilio. Con los ingresos que percibe cubre sus gastos y los de su familia.
Navil desea comprar alimento concentrado para su ganado, para engordarlos apropiadamente para posteriormente venderlos. De esta manera  desean hacer crecer su negocio y poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.  Para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente obtener un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Navil is 31 years old, married, and has two children.  He lives with her family in a large community in the urban zone of the city of Zaña, part of the city of Chiclayo, capital of the Lambayeque department.

Navil has been raising cattle and small animals for 10 years.  He fattens them up until they reach the ideal size and weight and then sells them.  He does this from his home.  He supports his family with this income.

Navil would like to buy concentrated feed for his livestock in order to fatten them up and later sell them.  In this way he can improve his family’s quality of life.  He has decided to request a loan of 1,000 PEN in order that he can achieve his objective.

loans.use: to buy feed.

loans.name: Maria Virginia

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de productos de belleza como lapiz labiales,perfumes y cremas,als ocia vende en forma independiente,al socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los productos de belleza.La socia solicita el credito para comprar lapiz labiales,cremas y perfumes.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Maria Virginia works selling cosmetics like lipstick, creams and perfumes. She is an independent saleswoman and works from 8am to 7pm. Through her business she has been able to help her children get ahead and her dream is to one day have her own cosmetics store. She is requesting a loan in order to buy lipstick, cream and perfume. 

Maria Virginia is very happy to receive this loan and promises to pay it back on time.

loans.use: to buy lipsticks, creams and perfumes

loans.name: Cristhian Hipolito

texts.es:
Cristhian es un joven de 24 años de edad, vive al lado de sus padres quienes se dedican a la agricultura y por quienes ha aprendido sobre el trabajo, la honradez y sobre todo la humildad y por quienes se sienten muy orgulloso ya que a pesar de su humildad siempre le han dado buenas enseñanzas. Su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de imperial, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido y acogedor, asimismo se desarrolla la agricultura en especial los cultivos de algodón, maíz, plátano, entre otros. Cristhian anteriormente trabajaba junto a sus padres en los campos de cultivo, pero un tiempo después ingreso a un fundo, en el cual se siembran árboles para la venta de las cosechas en los mercados de la ciudad,  lleva trabajando en este fundo desde hace ya 4 años, en los cuales diariamente trabaja alrededor d e9 horas. El cree que le va bien en su trabajo ya que es muy responsable y sobre todo porque tiene mucho conocimiento.

Cristhian está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá realizar unos mejoramientos en su vivienda como arreglar el techo de su casa, comprar una cocina ya que sus padres solo cocinan a leña y es un poco peligroso; de esta manera mejorara su calidad de vida  y seguirá luchando para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Darle una buena calidad de vida a sus padres y tener un negocio propio”.
texts.en:
Cristhian is 24 years old. He lives next-door to his parents, who are farmers and from whom he has learned about hard work, honor and humility. He is very proud of his parents because despite their humility, they have always taught him important lessons. His home is located in the city of Imperial, which is known for it's warm and welcoming climate. There is a lot of agriculture in the area, especially of cotton, corn, bananas and more. 

Cristhian used to work with his parents in the fields but then he began working on a different farm, where they grow trees in order to sell the fruit in city markets. He has been working on this farm for 4 years and he usually works 9 hours a day. He thinks he is good at his job because he is very responsible and knowledgeable. 

Cristhian is very grateful to the Kiva lenders. Thanks to their help he will be able to complete some repairs on his house, like fixing the roof and buying a kitchen. His parents only cook by campfire and it is a little dangerous. Cristhian will be able to improve his quality of life and continue fighting to achieve his biggest dream: to give his parents a good quality of life and start his own business.

loans.use: to improve his home by fixing his roof and buying a kitchen.

loans.name: Ericka Elizabeth

texts.es:
Ericka tiene 33 años de edad, vive en l distrito de Santiago, el cual se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido, asimismo se desarrolla la agricultura en especial el cultivo de algodón, maíz, paprika, esparrago, alcachofa, entre otros. Cuando Ericka tiene un tiempo libre le gusta mucho ver televisión, en especial sus novelas y sobre todo aprovecha en algunas oportunidades para comer uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo “Arroz con Pollo”. Ella estuvo estudiando la carrera de Secretariado ejecutivo, pero por problemas económicos no la pudo terminar.

Con mucho entusiasmo Ericka trabaja como operaria en un grifo, diariamente labora alrededor de 10 horas al día, es un trabajo un poco cansado ya que mayormente tiene que estar de pie casi todo el día para atender a los clientes, ella cree que le va bien en sus trabajo porque los clientes que atiende siempre regresan con gusto ya que ella es muy amable y por ello no hay quejas de ella.

Ericka está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar muebles para su vivienda ya que actualmente en su casa solo se sientan en ladrillos forrados y comen en una mesa improvisada a base de tripley, de esta manera ella podrá mejorar su calidad de vida y así seguir trabajando cada día para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener su casa propia ya que actualmente vive en casa alquilada”.
texts.en:
Ericka is 33 years old. She lives in the district of Santiago, which is known for its warm climate. Agriculture is a common activity there, especially the cultivation of cotton, corn, peppers, asparagus, and artichokes, among other crops. When Ericka has free time, she enjoys watching television, especially her favorite serial dramas, and above all, she likes to take advantage of opportunities to eat her favorite dishes, such as the delicious “Arroz con Pollo” [chicken with rice]. She was studying to become an executive secretary, but due to economic problems, she was not able to complete her degree. 

With great enthusiasm, Ericka works as an operator at a gas station. She works about 10 hours each day. It is rather tiring work, since she usually has to be on her feet almost all day to serve the customers. She believes that her work is going well for her, because the customers she serves always come back happily, since she is very friendly and for this reason there are no complaints about her. 

Ericka is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, since thanks to the help they have provided to her, she will be able to buy furniture for her home, since currently at her house people sit only on bricks covered with fabric, and they eat at an improvised table made of plywood. In this way she will be able to improve her quality of life, and thus keep working each day to make her greatest dream a reality: "to have her own house," since she currently lives in a rented house.

loans.use: to buy furniture for her home.

loans.name: Rosa Miriam

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 33 años de edad, es casada, tiene 4 hijos y vive en la colonia Lopez Arellano del Municipio de Choloma, Cortes.
Rosa aprendió a coser cuando era pequeña. Con la ayuda de su ingenio, compró su primera maquina y empezó a prosperar. Hace 12 años puso su negocio un Taller de Confección de prendas de vestir  como blusas, vestidos, uniformes, camisetas, faldas etc. Su taller lo tiene establecido en la parte trasera de su vivienda donde acondiciono un espacio para trabajar. También se propuso establecer este negocio en la necesidad de mantener a sus hijos y poder superarse y ser una persona de provecho. Ella cuenta con su propia clientela, la cual le motiva más para hacer sus prendas con buena calidad para que sus clientes queden satisfechos.
Rosa  ha solicitado 2 créditos con ODEF. Ella comenta que le ha ido increíblemente ya que ha comprado otras maquinas.  Con este crédito actual de 25,000 lempiras  lo invertirá en el local ya que esta un poco deteriorado y las mejoras que le hará es  cambiarle todo el techo y cambiar todo el sistema eléctrico para darle  mejor apariencia al negocio y también para seguir ejerciendo su actividad satisfactoriamente como hasta el momento lo ha hecho.
Su meta es poder expandirse en el mercado, obteniendo clientes nuevos y que sus hijos culminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
Rosa is 33 years old, married, and has four children. She lives in the subdivision of Lopez Arellano in the town of Choloma, Cortes.

Rosa learned how to sew when she was a young girl. With the help of her ingenuity, she bought her first machine and began to prosper. Twelve years ago, she established her sewing workshop where she produces blouses, dresses, uniforms, T-shirts, skirts, and other articles. Her workshop is situated in an area behind her house that has adequate space for her to work. Another reason why she started this business was because she needed to support her children as their provider and help them excel. Rosa has her own customer base, which motivates her to make more clothes that are of good quality. This will keep her customers satisfied.

Rosa has requested two loan from ODEF. She says that she has done incredibly well since buying two other machines. With her current loan of 25,000 HNL, Rosa will invest in her workshop since it has gradually deteriorated and is need of improvements. She will replace the entire roof and electrical system so that her business will have a better appearance. This will enable her to continue working in a satisfactory manner, just as she has done to this point. Her goal is to expand in the marketplace by gaining new customers. She also wants her children to finish their studies.

loans.use: to pay for improvements (a new roof and electrical system) to her sewing workshop.

loans.name: Arceli

texts.en:
This is Arceli, 52, a resident of Taguig City, Philippines. She is married to Frank, a driver, and a mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. 

Arceli operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which sells groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, five pesos-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns money by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day. 

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 20,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Arceli hopes to be able to expand soon and dreams to be able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Martin

texts.en:
Martin is a 40-year-old married man with two children. He describes himself as being determined at his work. He operates a hardware store, where he sells items such as ink, wheels, spanners and spare parts. He has been involved in this business for seven years. His store is located within a residential area and his primary customers are local residents. Martin describes his biggest business challenge as having insufficient funds to improve the business. He will use the 21,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) loan to buy a water tank.

Previously, Martin has had three loans, all of which he managed to pay off (20,000, 50,000 and 250,000 KES). His business goal is to run another hardware store so as to increase his income within five years.

loans.use: to buy a water tank

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
This is Lilian, 50, a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is a mother of one, and married to Benjamin, an overseas contract worker. She, together with her child, manages their own household while operating the business. She  works hard to provide income for their everyday expenses. 

Lilian operates an ornamental plant business. She grows garden plants that are native to the Philippines like ylang-ylang, golden shower, and dahlias, varieties of hanging plants, and others. Her regular customers are local tourists, neighbors, and the nearby community. She earns a minimum of 300 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day. 

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 20,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy fertilizer and garden inputs for her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Lilian dreams of growing her business in the coming years. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for gardening materials and other products needed in her business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy a new donkey cart for a hauling business

loans.name: Melvin Rafael

texts.es: Melvin Rafael, tiene la edad  de 47 años, está casado, vive con sus hijos y esposa  que son su mayor prioridad. Él con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de fertilizantes, fungicidas y pagar mano de obra para la asistencia de café, y de esta manera asegurarse de realizar una buena aplicación de productos y hacer un buen trabajo. Lo que pretende es aprovechar las buenas condiciones de suelo y topografía que cuenta la propiedad para este cultivo, y también poner en práctica la experiencia en el manejo de café. Además de poder comprar los mejores productos y de mejor calidad para que su plantación tenga un buen desarrollo y sanidad, y tener a corto o mediano plazo una producción adecuada. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Melvin Rafael is 47 years old. He is married, and he lives with his children and his wife, who are his greatest priority. With his loan, he intends to buy fertilizers and fungicides and to pay for labor to help with the coffee crop. In this way he will ensure that he can do a good job and have a good application of products. His intention is to take advantage of the property's good soil and topographic conditions for this crop, and also put into practice his experience growing coffee. In addition, he will be able to buy the best products, of the best quality, so his plantation will have good growth and good health, and he will have adequate production over the short and medium term. This is the first loan he has received from FUDECOSUR. He has not had other loans in the past from state banks, but FUDECOSUR provided him the loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and fungicides and pay for labor to help with his coffee crop.

loans.name: William Rodrigo

texts.es:
WILLIAM RODRIGO tiene 28 años de edad es casado tiene un hijo, vive con la hija de 7 años de edad y con la esposa en Ventanas provincia de los Ríos.

 WILLIAM RODRIGO se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz. Solicita el credíto para comprar abonos, fertilizantes, semillas, insecticidas.

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar los abonos sin ninguna dificultad. El desafío al que se enfrenta es el mal tiempo.

El sueño es poder construir una casa. En el tiempo libre le gusta salir de compras con la esposa y con la hija.
texts.en:
William Rodrigo, 28, is married and has a child.  He lives with his seven-year-old daughter and his wife in Ventanas, Los Ríos Province.

William Rodrigo works in agriculture growing corn.  He is requesting the loan to buy manure, fertilizer, seed, and insecticide.

With the help of the loan he will have no problem buying the fertilizers.  The challenge he faces is bad weather.

His dream is to build a house.  In his free time he likes to go shopping with his wife and daughter.

loans.use: to buy manure, fertilizer, seed, and insecticide.

loans.name: Sumac Wata Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SUMAC WATA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Senovia ella es casada y tiene 46 años y tiene 3 hijos; La socia trabaja con su negocio de venta de fruta.la socia vende manzanas, platanos, uvas, mandarinas entre otras frutas, la socia vende desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 8:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, el sueño de la socia es ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de fruta. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar manzanas, naranjas, uvas, platanos y mandarinas.
 Los otros socios  se dedican al negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de venta de repuestos de carros, negocio de venta de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de crianza de animales

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to the communal bank "Sumac Wata". The bank is located in the district of Cusco that belongs to the province of Cusco and the departent of Cusco.

The member is Senovia. She is 46, married, and has 3 children. 
She works selling fruits, she sells apples, bananas, grapes, tangerines among other fruits. She works from 7:00am 'til 8:00pm. With this business she brings her children up. Her dream is to expand and improve her business of fruit selling.

She asks for this loan to buy apples, oranges, grapes, bananas and tangerines.

The other members of the bank make a living selling clothes, selling car parts, selling groceries and breeding farm animals.

Senovia is grateful to the people who is part of her dream through this medium (Kiva) and commits herself to the payment of her loan installments in due time.

loans.use: to buy apples, oranges, grapes, bananas and tangerines.

loans.name: Bubirayho

texts.ru: Бубирайхо продолжает свою деятельность. Она занимается посевом зерновых культур. Кредит берет для закупа семян.
texts.en: Bubirayho continues her farming activity and is currently cultivating grains. She is taking this loan to purchase seeds.

loans.use: to purchase seeds

loans.name: El Clavel Group

texts.es:
Leodegaria  es una señora  de 48 años de edad, está casada con el señor Oscar quien se dedica al campo. Tienen 7 hijos pero ya ninguno vive con ellos así que solo se mantienen ellos dos. 
Doña Leodegaria se dedica a la venta de comida y tiene su negocio en su casa o en ocasiones cuando pagan el apoyo a las familias de bajos recursos ella va a vender al lugar donde le piden, es así como lleva un año en su negocio. Ella necesita tener un menú variable y piensa comprar más insumos de elaboración de comida como jitomates, cebollas, carne y platos entre otras cosas. Es en lo que utilizará su crédito. 
Leodegaria es una de las 10 integrantes del grupo El Clavel que a continuación se mencionarán así como cada una de las actividades a las que se dedican: Ernestina se dedica a la compra venta de pescados, Maricela vende refrescos, Rosalba también vende pescado, Rubicela vende quesos, Candelaria vende dulces, Yesenia vende productos de belleza, Julia también vende pescado, Cuberta vende productos de abarrotes, Leodegaria vende comida e Ines vende ropa.
texts.en:
Leodegaria is a woman of 48, and is married to Oscar who is a farmer. They have seven children, but now none of them live with them, so they only support the two of them. 

Leodegaria sells food and has her business in her home. Sometimes when they pay assistance to low-income families, she goes to sell at the place where they request it. This is how she has been in her business for a year.

She needs to have a varied menu, and intends to buy more supplies for preparing food, such as tomatoes, onion, meat, dishes and other things. This is what she will use her loan for. 

Leodegaria is one of ten members of the "El Clavel" group. Each one of the activities done by the members is cited next. 

Ernestina buys and sells fish, Maricela sells soft drinks, Rosalba also sells fish, Rubicela sells cheeses, Candelaria sells candy, Yesenia sells beauty products, Julia also sells fish, Cuberta sells grocery products, Leodegaria sells food, and Ines sells clothing.

loans.use: To buy more supplies for preparing food, such as tomatoes, onions, chili peppers, meats, dishes, etc.

loans.name: Buzaiyrakan

texts.ru:
Бузайиракан  - участник группы «Кенсе Суу», ей 47 лет, замужем, мать 3 детей. В качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи, Бузайиракан с 1995 года занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы в 2,000 сом (KGS). На сегодня в хозяйстве Бузайиракан имеется 1 корова с приплодом. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Бузайиракан обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку скота.  Доходы от кредита Бузайиракан планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение хозяйства.
texts.en:
Buzaiyrakan is a member of the Kense Suu group. She is 47 years old, married, and a mother of 3 children. As the main source of income for her family, Buzaiyrakan raises livestock, having started her business in 1995 with a sum of 2,000 som (KGS). Presently, she keeps 1 cow with its offspring.

In order to continue developing her business, Buzaiyrakan has turned to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 30,000 som (KGS) to buy more livestock. She plans to invest her profits from this loan into further expansion of her business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Shafqat's Group

texts.en:
Shafqat has applied for a loan from KIVA Partner Asasah for her husband’s mirror selling business. He sells mirrors, which are used for home decoration and household use.  With the loan, he will buy mirrors for selling to his clients.  He is very experienced in his business and has been operating it for many years, and Shafqat is hopeful that the loan will help him to make more profit for his business.

She is very supportive and sews clothes for her neighboring clients. She has great skills and receives regular orders every month.  Her family trusts her very much and has a lot of respect for her due to her helpful nature.  Shafaqt has given birth to three sons.  Two of them are studying while her youngest is not of school going age yet.  She is hopeful that with the improved income of her husband, she will be able to continue giving education to her children.

loans.use: to buy mirrors for a mirror selling business.

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de churros (es como un postre que tiene relleno de manjar),la socia vende en forma ambulatoria desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de churros.La socia solicita el credito para comprar insumos para preparar los churros como harina,mantequilla,manjar y azucar.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member works selling churros (a dessert filled with dulce de leche). She is a mobile vendor and works from 8am to 7pm. Through this business she is able to support her children. 

Her goal is to expand the churro-selling business. She is requesting this loan in order to purchase ingredients for the churros such as flour, butter, dulce de leche, and sugar. She is happy to receive the loan and commits to making the payments.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for churros such as flour, butter, dulce de leche, and sugar.

loans.name: Siyovush

texts.ru: Сиёвуш женат и на воспитании двоих детей. У него дети еще маленькие, старшему 2,5 года и младшему 1,5 года. Сиёвуш более1 года занимается выпечкой кондитерских изделий. Его жена помогает ему, дома выпекает разные виды булочек и пирожных, а Сиёвуш продает на рынке. Своим клиентам он готовит кофе и чай, чтобы они приходили ещё. Сиёвуш хотел бы получить займ для покупки продуктов для изготовления кондитерских и хлебобулочных изделий для пополнения оборотного капитала с целью расширения бизнеса.
texts.en:
Siyovush is married and raising two young children who are 2.5 and 1.5 years of age. For over a year, Siyovush has been earning a living as a confectionery baker. His wife helps him with the business by baking at home various buns and pastries, which Siyovush then sells at the market. He also offers coffee and tea to his customers to entice them to come back.

Siyovush would like to obtain a loan to purchase ingredients for preparing breads and pastries, as well as to increase his working capital in order to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase baking ingredients

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
This is Zenaida, 62, a resident of Bacoor, Cavite City, Philippines. She is a widow and a mother to her four children. She, together with her children, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Zenaida maintains a direct selling business.
